title: 50.25 BANKS ORGANIZED UNDER THE LAWS OF MINNESOTA; CAPITAL STOCK; AMENDMENT OF ARTICLES.
text: A corporation which was incorporated and organized under the laws of Minnesota for the purpose of doing a savings bank business, may have capital stock of $100 per share, par value; provided, the minimum required capital shall not be less than $500,000. The capital funds of a proposed savings bank shall be in such greater amount which the commissioner considers necessary, having in mind the deposit potential for such a proposed bank and current industry standards of capital adequacy.
